data.stimulus:
We're going to start this lesson by looking at an example report brief and comparing it to your assessment report.

 

► What differences / similarities can you see between this example and your assignment brief?

possible_responses: In your country and the UK
data.stimulus:
Let's continue analysing the example brief and comparing it to your own assignment.

► Complete the table below (drag and drop)

Your Assignment

stems: Advantages and disadvantages of shared flats
History of Flat-sharing in the UK
data.stimulus:

Note: you should include a similar section in your assignment.

data.stimulus:
Next, let's focus on the CONTENT of the report.

As you can see, the writer divided the report into sections and used section headings.

 

 

► Select the best sentence to summarise the content of each section:

(You can find a copy of the text in the HERE.)
data.template:
• In the INTRODUCTION, the writer talked about {{response}} and {{response}}.
  • In the section SHARED FLATS,  the writer talked about {{response}}.
  • In the section CONVENIENCE, the writer suggested {{response}}.
  • In the section SOCIALISING, the writer gave {{response}}.
  • In the section PRIVACY, the writer explained {{response}}.
  • In the CONCLUSION AND RECOMMENDATION, the writer talked about {{response}} and made {{response}}.

value: which kind of student accommodation the report is going to focus on.
reasons why shared flats can make students' lives easier.
reasons why shared flats can help students make friends.
why shared flats are not suitable if you like being alone.
the balance of all the benefits and drawbacks of shared flats
suggestions for people who are considering sharing a flat.

data.stimulus:
Finally, let's focus on the...

 

 

► Read this section again:

(You can find a copy of the text in the HERE.)
data.template:
• Does the conclusion contain a summary of all the points assessed? {{response}}
  • Is there any new information in the conclusion? {{response}}
  • Do you think the writer has addressed all parts of the assignment? {{response}}

data.stimulus:
In this part of the lesson, we will focus on language.

 

► In last week's lesson, you studied...

 

 

 

Which contrast linkers did the writer use in the example report?

data.template:

(you can find a copy of the text HERE)

• In the section 'Socialising' the contrast linker used is {{response}}.

(you can find a copy of the text HERE)

• In the section 'Privacy' the contrast linker used is {{response}}.

(you can find a copy of the text HERE)

data.stimulus:
Apart from contrast linkers, you will also need to use linkers to list or add points. 

► These linking words help you organise different ideas in a paragraph.

 

 

 

Which addition linkers did the writer use in the example report?

► Write the exact words in the boxes below (check your spelling carefully).
data.template:
• In the section 'Convenience' the addition linker used is {{response}}.

(you can find a copy of the text HERE)

• In the section 'Socialising' the addition linkers used are {{response}} and {{response}}.

(you can find a copy of the text HERE)

• In the section 'Privacy' the addition linker used is {{response}}.

(you can find a copy of the text HERE)

data.stimulus:
Even tough the vocabulary used in the example report is generally formal and academic, the two sentences below contain less suitable words.

 

► Highlight the words in the sentences below that are NOT suitable for academic writing. 

(ONE word in each sentence)
data.template:
1. “This is fantastic for students because they are often not familiar with the process”

2. “Some people may find that having to share a living room and kitchen is horrible“.

data.stimulus: Why are these words not suitable for academic writing?

data.template:
Which words could you use to replace them?

  •  Sentence 1: {{response}}
  • Sentence 2: {{response}}

value: The writer uses personal language (I / you).

possible_responses: The writer uses personal language (I / you).
data.stimulus:
The grammar used in the example report is also generally formal and academic, apart from the sentence below:

 

I would recommend this kind of accommodation if you are sociable and enjoy a busier lifestyle.
data.template:
What is the problem with it? 

{{response}}

value: The writer uses personal language (I / you).

options.label: This kind of accommodation is recommended to students who are sociable and enjoy a busier lifestyle
This kind of accommodation I recommended to students who are sociable and enjoy a busier lifestyle
This kind of accommodation is recommending to students who are sociable and enjoy a busier lifestyle
This kind of accommodation has recommended to students who are sociable and enjoy a busier lifestyle

data.stimulus:
How can you make this sentence more suitable for an academic report?

 

(Think carefully, you only have ONE check answer attempt!)

stems: Housing Council (2019). Shared flats on the rise in major cities. https://www.housingcouncil.gov.uk/housing/Pages.aspx
Smith, R. (2019). ‘Shared flats – what to expect in the 21st century’. London Journal of Estate Management, 22(2), 6-12.
